titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8) to make the repeal of the estate tax permanent.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8) to make the repeal of the estate tax permanent.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-35, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 20.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 202.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 202 the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 237 - 195 (Roll no. 100).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8) to make the repeal of the estate tax permanent.
